TopicTitle: Loading quicksave of plane in Laythe atmosphere creates strange static polygons and warped kerbal animations

Articles.Content:
• KSP Version: 0.1.0.0.20892
  • Operating System and version  (Windows 10, Windows 11): Windows 10
  • CPU and GPU models, any other system information which could be relevant: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-10400F CPU @ 2.90GHz, 2904 Mhz, 6 Core(s), 12 Logical Processor(s), NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060
  • Description of the bug: Loading quicksave of plane in Laythe atmosphere creates strange static polygons and warped kerbal animations. See attached video. 
  • Steps to Replicate: Load the attached plane into the VAB, launch it on runway 1. Hit ALT + H and use Lazy Orbit to move it to Laythe at an orbit of 100 km. Descend into the atmosphere and hit F5 to quicksave at about 4 km. Close the game. Reopen the game, load the latest save, then hit F9 to quickload the quicksave.
  • Fixes / Workarounds (if known..): Hit F9 to quickload again.
  • A list of ALL mods.  If the list is long, please consider using a spoiler window.: BepInEx, SpaceWarp, LazyOrbit
  • Other Notes / Screenshots / Log Files (if possible..): 
    • Video: https://imgur.com/a/ORN1mIj
    • Ship: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OS865ELDJoNnSa-73EW9pRmW5ncwZ83i/view?usp=sharing
Edited March 13, 2023 by Max31
Reuploaded ship as file link rather than text in forum.

Welcome to our forum, Max31.   I'm one of the moderators here. 

We're sorry to tell you that we've had to removed the log file from your post. While those are helpful when diagnosing problems, they are also so large that they cause problems for the forum. Please upload the log file to a sharing service and use the link they provide in your post here.
